description: A boy swings from a rope attached to a tree that strangely bears anvils instead of leaves or fruit. His mother stands nearby, warning him about the danger of playing under this peculiar tree, implying that anvils regularly fall from it. The scene presents an absurd and surreal situation where a common backyard setting is rendered perilous by a tree that defies natural laws. The mother's casual, albeit stern, warning highlights the dark humor and irony of treating such an extraordinary threat as a routine parental concern.
caption: "All right, Billy, you just go right ahead! ... I've warned you enough times about playing under the anvil tree!"
